page.title: 19CRAWTON
page.content: There are few records about Crawton. We know that there were twenty three houses in Crawton and also twelve boats went out to sea. The people in Crawton were very poor. The ladies' jobs were baiting the lines. However, the fish became scarce and the people of Crawton took a share in a large Stonehaven boat which went further out to sea. The last fisherman packed up and left Crawton in 1927. Now Crawton has a Bird Sanctuary called Fowlsheugh near it and it is a very beautiful but wild place. Today some people are again living in Crawton but there are no boats going out to fish. Today we have read in the newspaper that someone has bought land at Crawton and wants to build houses there.
